vi: I didn't mean to be intrusive and interrupt your manoeuvres.

en: a torri ar draws eich manoeuvres chi.
-Wel, mi wnest ti, yndo? -Mi wnes i drio ffonio chdi.
vi: -Well, you did, didn't you? -I tried phoning.

en: -Roedd dy fobile di off. -Cool head 'wan, Leswold.
Be 'dy'r panics mawr 'ma?
Wel, Michael, ma'r Scarlet Pimpernel 'di neud fflit eto, do?
vi: Well, Michael, Scarlet Pimpernel has done another flit.

en: -Pwy? -Carbo 'de. Mae o 'di abandon ship.
Ma' o 'di gadael Cwch y Moch medda Antonia.
vi: -Antonia says he left Cwch y Moch. -Bwlch y Gloch?

en: Bwlch y Gloch?
Ia, fan'na, whatever. God knows lle mae o.
vi: Yes, there, whatever. God knows where he is.

en: You wait 'til I get my hands on the little...
vi: You wait 'til I get my hands--

en: Calm down, Leswold!
Blydi waster 'dy o. I told you so 'do.
vi: He's a bloody waster! I told you so.

en: Wnei di fod yn dawel am un eiliad, plîs, Les, i mi gael cyfle i feddwl.
vi: Will you be quiet for a second and give me a chance to think?

en: Estynna gan i ni o'r ffrij.
Wna i ffonio Cwch y Moch.
Oh, for fuck's sake, Bwlch y Gloch, i weld be 'dy'r crac.
vi: oh, for fuck's sake, Bwlch y Gloch, to see what the crack is.

en: Blydi hel!
Be 'wan?
You could feed the world a parcio dwy lori yn y ffrij 'ma, Mic.
vi: You could feed the world and park two lorries in this massive fridge.

en: Mae'n massive.
Siŵr bod y gegin newydd 'ma 'di costio dipyn, hefyd.
vi: This new kitchen cost a pretty penny

en: I bet my shiny shoes.
Ti'n meddwl?
Ma'n rhaid bod y worktops imitation granite 'ma
vi: The imitation granite worktops cost a pretty penny, too.

en: 'di costio pretty penny 'fyd.
Big bucks 'swn i'n deud.
Gwranda, Les
ddim fy mai i ydy o bod ti'n gwario'r cyflog da 'na
vi: it's not my fault you spend the good salary I pay you

en: dw i'n talu i chdi ar whores, cebabs a phowdrach, naci?
vi: on whores, kebabs and powder, is it?

en: Felly dyro gorau iddi, iawn?
vi: So give it a rest, okay?

en: Ia.
Dw i'n very sorry. Chdi sy'n iawn eto.
vi: I'm very sorry. You're right again.

en: Bit of banter, isn't it?
- Dw i'n very sorry, Mic. -Mae'n iawn, Les.
Mae jyst pawb tipyn bach on edge.
vi:
It's just…
 we're all a bit on edge.

en: Eniwe, Leswold, marble ydyn nhw.
Marble 'dy pwy?
Y worktops. Marble 'dyn nhw, ddim imitation granite.
vi: The worktops are marble not imitation granite.

en: Pwy?
Ddim imitation granite 'dy'r worktops. O, dim ots, Les.
vi: They're imitation granite… oh, never mind, Les.

en: Ti isio gem o snakes and ladders am fiver ta?
vi: Fancy a game of snakes and ladders for a fiver?

en: Symuda di fodfedd, mi chwala i dy frains di fatha spaghetti hoops
vi:
Move an inch…
 I'll smash your brains like spaghetti hoops across the yard.

en: ar draws y buarth 'ma.
Ylwch...
'mond isio estyn fy mhetha yng nghefn y fan ydw i.
vi: I only want to get my holdall from the van.

en: Fy holdall a ballu. Dangosa i chi os ga' i gyfle.
vi: I'll show you if you give me a chance.

en: Dod yma i ddwyn y fan a'r motor-beic wnest ti go iawn, 'de?
vi: You came to steal the van and motorbike.

en: Naci!
vi: No, I didn't, trust me. I don't have the keys!

en: Naci, wir yr. 'Sgin i mo'r goriad, nag oes?
Ti'm angen goriad, nagwyt? Y pidlan.
vi: You don't need a key, do you, twat!

en: Jyst...
plîs...
rhowch y gwn lawr.
Reit.
Bacia.
Tro rownd.
Cerdda am ddrws y stabl 'na.
'Wan!
Reit. That's better, isn't it?
Leave it, ddynas!
Leswold, plîs.
Ga' i ddod efo chi?
vi: Can I come with you? I'll take the little dogs to the kennels.

en: Fedra i fynd a'r little dogs i'r kennels.
Na, very sorry, not today, Mother. Dyna 'dy'r ordors.
vi: No, very sorry, not today, Mother.

en: Oh, I see.
vi:
Just following orders.
 Oh, I see. Not good enough for you and Slicky Finn anymore, no?

en: Not good enough i chdi a Slicky Finn anymore, no?
Surplus to requirements rwan, ia?
Dim dyna 'dy o. 'Dan ni'm yn gwybod yn iawn ein hunain be sy'n digwydd.
vi: It's not that. We don't even know what's happening.

en: Plîs, Leswold.
Ma'n siŵr bod 'na rywbeth fedra i wneud yn y set-up yn y joban, plîs.
vi: There must be something I can do on the job. Please?

en: I can make you tea, rhwbath.
Gas gen i fod yn y tŷ 'ma ar ben fy hun.
vi: I hate being in this house on my own.

en: And you know very well I hear voices yng nghanol y nos
vi: And you know very well I hear voices in the night when you're not here.

en: pan ti ddim yma.
Ylwch, Mother, ga' i air efo Mici oce. Rhoia i ring i chi later on.
vi: Look, Mother, I'll have a word with Mici. I'll ring you later on.

en: 'Ma chi, ylwch.
Pres bingo i chi.
O'n i 'di gneud sandwiches a fflasgs i ni gael on the way
vi: I'd made sandwiches and flasks to have on the way.

en: ond bydd yn rhaid i chdi rannu nhw efo Mici 'wan.
vi:
You have to share them with Mici now.
 Hang on.

en: Blydi hel, Mother! Ych a fi!
Leave me be, will you?
Hei, Ffredrico!
Ti isio dŵr?
Awe 'ta, Mic?
Ia. Awe, Les.
Stopiwn ni am frecwast yn rhywla, Mic?
vi: Shall we stop somewhere for breakfast, Mr Finnley?

en: Aye, Mr Finnley.
Neu gawn ni spot of lunch on the way os lici di.
vi: Or a spot of lunch on the way, if you like.

en: Whatever you want, Mici.
My treat, isn't it?
Ma' gen i fflasg a sandwiches i ni and everything.
vi: I've got a flask and sandwiches and everything…

en: Rhag ofn i ni fynd yn llwglyd on the way up.
vi: in case we get hungry on the way up.

en: 'Dy Meri-Jên ddim yn y boot by any chance, nac 'dy, Les?
vi: Is Meri Jen in the boot by any chance, Les?

en: Carbo?
Ti'n effro?
O'dd Mother ddim yn jumping for joy
vi: Mother wasn't jumping for joy she couldn't come.

en: bod hi ddim yn cael dod efo fi chwaith.
Na, not a happy bunny at all, isn't it.
vi: No, not a happy bunny at all, isn't it.

en: Waeth iddi heb a chwyno, Leswold.
Ma' hi 'di cael cynnig mynd ar bob blydi cruise a holiday sy gynnon ni.
vi: She gets offered all the bloody cruises and holidays going.

en: Hmm?
Hmm.
Gyda llaw, Leswold, mae gynnon ni gynffon.
vi: By the way, Leswold, we've got a tail.

en: Hmm.
Ia.
Geith Carbo ddechrau gweithio'i magic ar y rheina.
vi: Carbo can start working his magic on these.

en: Lle ma' hwnnw beth bynnag?
Dal yn cysgu yn y stabl.
Wel, o'r Iesu Grist o'r sowth!
'Dy o'n bryd i rywun ddeffro fo a deutha fo be 'di be?
vi: Go and wake him and tell him what's what!

en: Wel, dach chi'm yn dallt, blantos?
Unwaith 'dan ni efo'n gilydd heno, mi fydd hi'n all systems go, bydd?
vi: once we're all together tonight it'll be all systems go?

en: Iasu, ma' isio mynadd efo chi, does?
Pam sa Mici a Les ddim wedi rhoi Carbo ar ben ffordd yn y lle cynta?
vi: Why didn't Mici and Les fill him in from the start?

en: Achos bo chi 'di deutha ni gyd i beidio, 'de, Dad.
vi: Because you told us not to, Dad.

en: Ma'r hogyn yn gweld trwyddom ni, ma'n amlwg.
Achos does neb ohonom ni 'di bod yn ddigon onest efo fo yn y lle cynta.
vi: because nobody is honest with him.

en: Dim bai ni 'dy hynny, naci, Dad?
vi: That isn't our fault, is it, Dad?

en: Ia, wel, ond o be wela i de
vi: Yes, well, from what I can see…

en: ma'n bryd i rywun ddeud y gwir wrtho fo am bob dim, on'd oes?
vi: it's time someone told him the truth.

en: Hmm?
Peidiwch a sbïo arna i.
Na finna.
Cachwrs!
Oce 'ta, Dad - siaradwch chi efo fo eich hun gan fod neb arall
vi: Okay, Dad, you talk to him yourself.

en: 'di manageio cael trwodd i'w ben mwd o
vi: No-one else can get through to his thick skull.

en: achos y lleia dw i'n neud efo fo, y gora.
vi: The least I do with him, the better.

en: Reit, ma' Aldo a fi yn mynd allan am y bore.
vi: Aldo and I are going out this morning.

en: -Lle fyddwch chi'n mynd? -'Dwn i'm.
vi: -Where are you going? -Don't know. Anywhere but here.

en: Rhywla ond fan'ma.
Dw i bron a mygu yn y blydi tŷ 'ma.
vi: I'm suffocated in this bloody house.

en: Ond...
As far as I can see, does 'na'm byd 'di plannu ar dy gar di, Mici.
vi: As far as I can see, nothing's planted under the car, Mici.

en: Wel mae un peth yn saff, mae 'na un arno fo.
Nathon nhw ddal i fyny efo ni erbyn Llanidloes yndo
vi: They caught up with us by Llanidloes

en: ar ôl i ni eu colli nhw unwaith.
'Dan ni definitely ddim isio iddyn nhw ddilyn ni
vi: We definitely don't want them following us to Bwlch y Gloch.

en: i fyny i Bwlch y Gloch, nac 'dan?
I see what you mean.
Lle fysat ti'n ei roi o, Les?
vi: Where would you put it, Les?

en: Bore da ychan!
Ddes i'm fan'ma neithiwr i ddwyn eich fan chi. Ar fy llw.
vi: I swear I didn't come here last night to steal the van.

en: Wel, sbia golwg arnach chdi.
vi: Well, look at the state of you.

en: Arglwydd fawr, ti'n edrych fel jac-do cloff
vi: Jesus wept, you look like a lame jackdaw

en: sy 'di disgyn lawr simnai'r stabl 'na.
vi: who fell down the stable chimney.

en: Sbia ar dy wallt di. Gwellt ym mhob man!
vi: Look at your hair, hay everywhere!

en: Bysat ti'n licio sefyll yn y cae 'na i ddychryn y brain i mi?
vi: Go stand in the field to scare the crows!

en: Ia, doniol iawn.
Ga' i fenthyg eich toiled chi, plîs? Dw i jyst a byrstio.
vi: Can I use your toilet, please? I'm bursting.

en: Syth i fyny'r grisiau a chyma bath tra ti wrthi, ti'n drewi fel burgun.
vi: Top of the stairs. Have a bath while you're at it, you stink!

en: Tywel ar ben y landin a ma' dy betha di ar fwrdd y gegin.
vi: There's a towel on the landing, and your stuff's on the kitchen table.

en: Diolch!
Reit, tyrd o 'na 'wan. Tyrd o 'na, washi!
-'Ma fo y blydi thing. -Shot, soldier.
Dw i'n meddwl ei chychwyn hi nôl.
Rho hwnna i mi.
Oglau neis arnat ti ychan.
vi: You smell nice. Got a date, have you?

en: Be sy gen ti? Dêt, ia?
Eh?
Roeddach chi'n 'nabod Dad, medda chi neithiwr.
vi: You said last night you knew Dad, said we were alike.

en: Deud bod ni yr un ffunud.
Dw i'n ei weld o o fy 'mlaen i
vi: I can see him now in front of me…

en: ynddoch chdi.
Sut oeddach chi'n ei 'nabod o ta?
Ti'n cofio Yncl Telor Awelfryn, wyt?
vi: Do you remember Uncle Telor Awelfryn?

en: Yndw, siŵr, mi fuodd o'n ffein iawn efo Mam a fi
vi: Of course. He was very kind to me and my Mum when I was a boy.

en: pan ro'n i'n hogyn bach.
Fo o'dd fy mrawd i, ti'n gweld.
Roedd o'n ffrindiau mawr efo dy dad. Dyna sut ddos i i'w 'nabod o.
vi: He was great friends with your Dad, so that's how I knew him.

en: Wela i.
Ond...
wedi damwain dy dad 'lly
mi aeth petha bach yn fflewt yma rhwng bob dim sdi.
Sut 'lly?
Wel, o'dd firm y Jack Huston 'ma o'dd dy dad yn gweithio iddyn nhw
roeddan nhw i fod i dalu iawndal i chdi a dy fam
vi:
where your Dad worked…
 was supposed to pay compo to you and your Mum after he died.

en: am farwolaeth dy dad, ti'n gweld
ond glywodd dy fam ddim byd am hir iawn
vi: But your mother didn't hear from them for a long time…

en: felly mi aeth Telor
i lawr i Lundain i chwilio am y pres ar eich rhan chi.
vi: went to London to chase up the money for you.

en: -Ffeindiodd o nhw? -Naddo.
vi:
Did he find them?
 No. They'd up sticks and done a runner.

en: O'n nhw 'di up sticks, doeddan. 'Di gleuo'i o 'na.
-Lle uffar oeddan nhw 'di mynd 'ta? -I le ma' pobl drwg i gyd yn mynd.
vi: -Where the hell did they go? -To where all the crooks go.

en: Sbaen.
Yn hollol.
Felly, dyma Telor ar eu holau nhw, cofia, ia.
Yn ei siwt ddydd Sul o yr holl ffordd i lawr i Alicante.
vi: in his Sunday best, all the way to Alicante.

en: Blydi hel! Chwarae teg iddo fo.
vi: Bloody hell! Fair play to him.

en: Be ddigwyddodd ta?
Mi glywodd clustia blewog y gang bod 'na ryw Welsh gentleman
vi: The crooks got wind that there was a Welsh gentleman looking for them.

en: yn chwilio amdanyn nhw yndo.
-Oh, no. -Oh, yes.
Mi dorrodd hogia'r Hustons i mewn i 'stafell wely Telor liw nos
vi: The Houston boys broke into Telor's hotel room one night…

en: a'i guro fo'n ddidrugaredd
vi: and beat him mercilessly with a pickaxe while he slept.

en: efo coes caib ac ynta yn ei wely.
-Y bastards di-asgwrn-cefn. -Blydi hel!
Be ddigwyddodd i Telor? O'dd o'n iawn?
vi:
Bloody hell!
 -What happened to Telor? Was he okay? -No, the poor sod died

en: Na, buodd y cruadur bach farw
bythefnos wedyn.
vi: a fortnight later of a fatal heart attack.

en: Hartan farwol.
-Go iawn? -F'engyl i ti.
-Nathoch chi'm cysylltu efo'r cops? -Na.
vi: -Didn't you tell the cops? -No. What for?

en: I be, hogyn?
Doeddan ni'm yn gallu profi ma' hogia'r Hustons
vi: We couldn't prove the Houston boys killed Telor.

en: laddodd Telor, nac oeddan?
Maen nhw nôl yn Llundain rwan, yli.
Ma' isio i rywun dalu nôl i'r bastards felly, does?
vi: Someone has to make the bastards pay for what they did to our families.

en: Am be nathon nhw i'n teuluoedd ni.
Dyna pam ti yma, Carwyn Robaitsh.
vi: That's why you're here, Carwyn Roberts.

en: Dyna pam ti yma.
Haia, troops!
Hai!
O, Mici!
Falch bod chi 'di cyrraedd yn saff.
Cafon ni gynffon on the way up, isn't it.
vi: We got tailed on the way up, isn't it.

en: Pwy oeddan nhw?
Yr Anhysbys. Chwilio am Carbo maen nhw.
Guaranteed.
Ga' i fenthyg y fan am awran gen ti, plîs, Antonia?
vi: Can I borrow the van for an hour, Antonia?

en: Taw a gofyn, hogyn! Dos a hi, siŵr Dduw, ma'r goriad ynddi.
vi: No need to ask. The key's in the ignition.

en: -Diolch -'Sgin ti side line efo Interflora 'wan?
Oes. Ti isio i fi ddelifro rhai i dy gnebrwng di?
vi:
Yes.
 Shall I deliver some at your funeral?

en: Yli, Les.
Dw i'n gwybod bod gen ti a dy lach ar yr hogyn ond o hyn ymlaen
vi: I know you've got it in for the boy

en: i ti gael dallt, mae o'n un ohonom ni, yli.
vi: but from now on, he's one of us.
Also His Dear Wife who Fell Asleep 22 December 2012

en: Dw i mor sori, Mam.
vi:
Loving Father and Mother of Carwyn Never Forgotten
 I'm so sorry, Mam.

en: Ches i ddim y llythyr yn Borstal
vi:
I didn't get the letter in Borstal…
 To tell me when your funeral was until it was too late.

en: i ddeutha fi pryd roedd eich cnebrwng chi
nes roedd hi'n rhy hwyr.
Dal i frifo fi
bob dydd
bod fi'm 'di bod yna i chi.
vi: that I wasn't there for you.

en: -Alright? -Arglwydd mawr!
vi:
Alright?
 You almost gave me a heart attack, Cidw! Where did you come from?

en: Bron i ti roi hartan i fi, Cidw! O le ddoist ti ychan?
O Lundain, Gronw.
Evening, pawb.
Iawn?
Haia.
Wel...
vi: Well, where's the blinking lockpicker extraordinaire?

en: ble ma'r blincin lock picker extraordinaire 'ma 'te?
Wedi mynd i weld Mami.
-Lle ma' honna'n byw 'wan, ta? -Ym mynwent Maentwrog.
Ateb o, fachgen.
Helo?
Helo, fi sy 'ma.
vi: -Hello, it's me. -Where the hell are you?

en: Lle uffar wyt ti?
Dw i 'mond pum munud i ffwrdd. Pam? Efo pwy dw i'n siarad?
vi: Only five minutes away. Who are you, anyway?

en: Y boi o'dd yn dal twelve-bore i gefn dy ben di neithiwr.
vi: The guy who held a shotgun to your head last night.

en: Dyna efo pwy ti'n siarad.
O. Wela i.
Ga' i air efo Gronw 'ta, plîs?
vi: Can I speak to Gronw please?

en: -Ti'n iawn, 'machgen i? -Ia, yndw, champion.
Dw i 'di stopio am fagiau o chips a 'chydig o ganiau i ni ar y ffor' adra.
vi: I stopped for chips and cans for us.

en: Wel, Duw, chwarae teg i ti Carbo am feddwl amdanom ni. Glywsoch chi hynna?
vi: Fair play to you, Carbo. Did you hear that?

en: Ma' Carbo'n mynd i brynu bagiau o chips a caniau i ni ar y ffor' nôl.
vi: Carbo's buying chips and cans for us. What do you want?

en: Rwan ta, be dach chi isio?
Chicken curry half and half.
Chips i fi, plîs a pys a curry sauce.
Wna i gymryd yr un peth a Mici a pys slwtsh a curry sauce.
vi:
I'll have the same as Mici
 with mushy peas and curry sauce.

en: Diolch i chi gyd am ymgynnull i'r cyfarfod hwn heno, gyfeillion.
vi: Thank you all for coming to this meeting tonight, friends.

en: Ma' lot o waith i wneud a dim ond ychydig ddyddiau i wneud o.
vi: We have a lot of work to do, and only a few days to do it.

en: Time is of the essence, chwedl y Sais
vi: Time is of the essence, as the saying goes.

en: felly heb wastraffu mwy o amser, draw atat ti, Cidw.
vi: Without wasting more time, I'll hand over to Cidw.

en: Diolch i chi, Gronw.
'Stedda, Les, for God's sake.
Oce, wel, diffodd y golau wnei di plîs, Ald? Nice one.
vi: Okay. Switch the light off, Ald.

en: Reit, gyfeillion.
Dyma pam 'dan ni yma.
I ddal y mellt.
Ie, Les?
Ga' i ofyn
be uffar ydy o?
Diamond, Leswold.
Diamond.
Blydi hel! Well, I never!
